intro: Sida tressensiae, commonly known as the Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and stamens that are often longer than the petals. Sida tressensiae is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
